item.title: Tip 319 - How to create custom handlers for Azure Functions
item.description: Azure Functions (opens new window) are great for running serverless pieces of code. Functions also provide triggers and bindings (opens new window), which make it easy to start a function, receive data and do something with that data, without writing plumbing code. You could already create Azure Functions in many languages, and now with Custom Handlers (opens new window), you can have a Function trigger any type of code.

item.description: A good philosophy to live by at work is to &ldquo;always be quitting&rdquo;. No, don&rsquo;t be constantly thinking of leaving your job 😱. item.title: 2021.06.08 Certificate Lifetime Incident (valid for an extra one second) - Incidents - Let's Encrypt Community Support
item.description: Let’s Encrypt is well-known for issuing certificates that are valid for only 90 days. Since the very first certificates issued by Let’s Encrypt’s infrastructure, those certificates have been given a 90 day validity period by our CA software by taking the issuance time and adding exactly 2,160 hours to yield the certificate’s “not after” date. However, RFC 5280 defines the validity period of a certificate as being the duration between the “not before” and the “not after” timestamps, inclusive. Th...

item.title: ALPACA Attack
item.description: TLS is an internet standard to secure the communication between servers and clients on the internet, for example that of web servers, FTP servers, and Email servers.
